timeline.message:
Add Run Test Scenario example

It is possible to work with Scesim files
inside VSCode.
Test Scenario Simulation works for DMN and awalible to use
if user includes Kogito ScenarioJunitActivator and
adds related scesim file to the project + add kogito scenario simulation dependency.

I made this example to look exactly as it is implemented in Business central to make it familiar for users.
Add test scope for junit test runner dpendency
Add Run Scenario Simulation example to dmn-quarkus-example

timeline.bodyText: We don't expect users to have any specific knowledge about Scenario Simulation, can we describe here what it does, where it is defined and what's the relation to DMN models?
timeline.author: jstastny-cz
timeline.diffHunk:

 java -jar ./target/dmn-springboot-example.jar
 ```
 
+### Run Scenario Simulation

replies.bodyText: I agree, it could be probably better to write something like "Test your DMN Model using Maven"
replies.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: again, please provide more info about what Scenarion Simulation is, where is defined and what's the relation to DMN models in this project.

Add details on scenario simulation functionality

Added to the #Scenario simulation section addition distribution how to define run and link scesim in example project

timeline.bodyText: In BC the name is Test Scenario so I think we should use the same name

+## Scenario simulation

timeline.bodyText: Please add that test result will be included in JUnit report
timeline.author: danielezonca
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -64,6 +64,16 @@ In addition, various clients to interact with this service can be easily generat
 
 When running in either Quarkus Development or Native mode, we also leverage the [Quarkus OpenAPI extension](https://quarkus.io/guides/openapi-swaggerui#use-swagger-ui-for-development) that exposes [Swagger UI](http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui/) that you can use to look at available REST endpoints and send test requests.
 
+## Scenario simulation
+
+Scenario simulation in Kogito enables you to validate the functionality of DMN models before deploying them into a production environment. 
+
+To define scenario simulation you need to create a .scesim file inside your project and link it to the DMN model you want to be tested. Run all Test Scenarios, executing:
